result.execSummary:
The defendant David A Holmstrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, David A Holmstrom was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David A Holmstrom is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • David A Holmstrom was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to probation officer within the next 48 hours.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Must not possess or consume controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health care provider.   Must not possess or consume intoxicating beverages. Must maintain absolute sobriety.
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.

timeConds.notes:
Court grants Huber or work release.
Must report to jail by 4:30 PM, today, September 22, 2015.

judgments.action: Found Not Guilty at Jury Trial

Defendant David A Holmstrom in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF47 & 15CF47
No corrections to PSI.
Argument by State.  14CF47 - 4 days jail credit.  15CF47 - 4 days credit.
9 months total jail requested between both cases.
Argument by Attorney Yonko.

Court relates and orders:
SW - 3 years probation (concurrent)
Any assessments or evaluations recommended by probation and comply with any follow-up treatment recommended.
No controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed health provider.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
No intoxicating beverages.
14CF47 - 6  months jail with huber or work release.
15CF47 - 6 months jail with huber or work release concurrent with 14CF47.
4 days credit on each case if probation is revoked.
Court costs.
15CF47 - DNA sample and surcharge only.

Defendant to report to probation officer within next 48 hours.
Defendant to begin serving jail today at 4:30 PM.

Order to Submit DNA Specimen form given to Defendant - 15CF47.
Voter's Rights form given to defendant.
Felony admission given.

Defendant David A Holmstrom in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
8:15 Case called.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.  Guilty plea entered to Count 1.  The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.
Counts 2, 3 and 4 are Dismissed and Read in.  Court does not order PSI be prepared in this case.  Bond continued.  Court orders PSI Order in 14CF47 be amended to indicate this case should be considered.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

$81.11 Jury Meals

Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges.

Defendant David A Holmstrom in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Russell Edward Berg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense requests witness sequestration. Defense waives right to public trial for juror questioning.

S. Millermon, Clerk
8:45 20 jurors seated.  8:48 All jurors sworn.  Court voir dire.  9:41 Jurors discuss in private answer to voir dire question.  10:08 Return to courtroom and 6 juror seats filled.  10:10 Voir dire by State.  10:10 Voir dire by Attorney Yonko.  10:14 Peremptory strikes made and Court gives opening jury instructions.  10:22 12 jurors sworn.  10:23 Jurors excused to move vehicles.  10:24  Remaining jurors excused.  Court is in recess.

Clerked by R. Winger
10:45 Court resumes outside of the presence of the jury. No objections by the parties for jurors to take notes during the trial. 10:51 Jurors seated. 10:52 State presents opening statement. 10:58 Defense presents opening statement. 
11:02 Kevin Kolb, Deputy with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
Exhibit 1- Metal object. Marked for State. 
11:09 Cross by Defense. 
11:13 David Kuffel, School Liaison Officer and previous Detective with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
Exhibit 2 - Photo. Marked for State. Exhibit 3 - Gem Bag. Marked for State. 
11:27 Cross by Defense. 11:33 Redirect by State. Defense objects. Objection sustained. 
11:34 Ron Bauers, Captain with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
Exhibit 4, 5  & 6 - Photos. Marked for State. Exhibit 7 - Items found in the garage. Marked for State. 
11:42 Cross by Defense. 11:45 Redirect by State. 11:45 Recross by Defense. 11:46 Jurors excused. 11:47 Court in recess.
12:47 Case resumes outside of the presence of the Jury. Parties do not have objections to the jury instructions or verdict forms. 
12:50 Jurors seated. 
12:51 Shane Robel, Correctional Officer with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
12:53 Cross by Defense. 
12:55 Jason Hagen, Detective with the Barron County Sheriff's Department, called, sworn and direct by State. 
Exhibit 8 - Photo. Marked for State. Exhibit 9 - Transmittal of Criminal Evidence Packet. 
1:16 Cross by Defense. State moves to offer exhibits 1-9. No objection by Defense. Court receives exhibits 1-9. 
1:24 Katie Hoffmeyer, controlled substance analyst with the Wisconsin State Crime Lab, called, sworn and direct by State. 
1:32 Cross by Defense. 1:36 State rests. 1:37 Jurors excused. Court resumes outside of the jury. 
1:37 Defense makes a motion for a directed verdict on counts 1 and 2. Argument by State. Court relates and denies the motions.  
1:42 Defendant waives right to testify. 1:48 Defense rests. Jury instructions reviewed between parties. 1:54 Court in recess. 2:11 Court resumes outside of the presence of the jury. 2:16 Jurors seated. Jury instructions read to jurors. 
2:33 Closing argument by State. 2:44 Closing argument by Defense. 2:52 Rebuttal by State. 2:58 Court discusses verdict form. 
3:02 Bailiff sworn. 3:02 Jurors excused for deliberation. 3:03 Court resumes outside of the presence of the jury. 3:04 Court in recess. Exhibits discussed. 
3:30 Court resumes for juror question and requests to see exhibit 1. State does not object and Defense does not object as long as the package remains sealed. Parties discuss the other exhibits to be given to the jurors for review. Court will provide the jury with exhibit 1. 3:34 Court in recess. 

S. Millermon, Clerk
4:22 Jury returns with verdict.
Count 1 - Guilty
Count 2 - Not Guilty

Jury polled.  
State requests PSI and sentencing hearing.  
Court finds defendant guilty of count 1 and orders PSI.
Attorney Yonko moves to dismiss count 2 and Court dismisses count 2 with prejudice.

Bond continues.
Defendant David A Holmstrom in court with attorney Richard Louis Yonko.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. No agreement. JT remains on the calendar.

Court makes findings that State has not asked that 2nd count of Information to be amended; has not added to or changed character of count since commencement of this action.
Court also finds and concludes that although item of alleged contraband that was not discovered until late in the game, it has not been so late in game that defense doesn't have opportunity to meet that allegation.
Court denies defendant's request to suppress items of evidence that was seized at or time of arrest and also will be allowed to introduce all items that are relevant as previously ruled on 1/2/15.
Bond to continue in its present form.
